definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: The poor girl was in tears.
sentences.chinese: 這個清苦女孩淚流滿面。

sentences.english: It seems austere but he enjoys it very much, never feeling insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 看似清苦，可是他甘之如飴，從不覺得還缺少什麼。

sentences.english: Living on selling benne, he led a hard and poor life.
sentences.chinese: 他靠賣胡麻爲生，日子過得很清苦。

sentences.english: The life of the troops was still comparatively austere .
sentences.chinese: 軍隊的生活還是相對清苦的。

sentences.english: We have to suck in our bellies for a period.
sentences.chinese: 我們得收緊褲帶，過一段時間的清苦日子了。
他們過着極端清苦的生活。

sentences.english: It's going to be a different reality —a more austere one —when we come out on the other end of this.
sentences.chinese: 當我們到達另一端，更爲清苦的一端，現實將會不同。

sentences.english: Accustomed to the morning wake-up with boiling water impoverished stomach perception.
sentences.chinese: 習慣了早上用清苦的沸水喚醒胃的知覺。

sentences.english: He lived a poor life in his childhood and developed interests in reading, calligraphy and seal cutting .
sentences.chinese: 他幼年時生活清苦，酷愛讀書，喜歡書法篆刻。

sentences.english: Recent research suggests this may not be so.
sentences.chinese: 最近的調查表明清苦可能北非如此。

sentences.english: Thus, Confucius lived in poverty with his mother since childhood.
sentences.chinese: 因此，童年的孔子和母親清苦度日。

definition: plain tea and simple food/(fig.) bread and water
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
tight (i.e. lacking money)/hard up/same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
to live one's life/to make a living
